# Solved by Shashwat Raj

n = int(input())
a = list(map(int, input().split()))
b = list(map(int, input().split()))

r = a[2] + b[1]
p = a[1] + b[2]
s = a[0] + b[0]

print(min(r, min(p, s)), max(r, max(p, s)))

#-----Solution-----

#Main function
def main():
    #Get input and assign variables
    n = int(input())
    a1, a2, a3 = map(int, input().split())
    b1, b2, b3 = map(int, input().split())
    
    #Create and assign variables
    a_win = 0
    b_win = 0
    
    #Get the win count for each
    a_win += min(a1, b2)
    a2 -= min(a1, b2)
    b2 -= min(a1, b2)

    a_win += min(a2, b3)
    a3 -= min(a2, b3)
    b3 -= min(a2, b3)

    a_win += min(a3, b1)
    a1 -= min(a3, b1)
    b1 -= min(a3, b1)
    
    #Get the win count for each
    b_win += min(b1, a2)
    a2 -= min(b1, a2)
    b1 -= min(b1, a2)

    b_win += min(b2, a3)
    a3 -= min(b2, a3)
    b2 -= min(b2, a3)

    b_win += min(b3, a1)
    a1 -= min(b3, a1)
    b3 -= min(b3, a1)
    
    #Print the win count for each
    print(a_win, n-b_win)

main()
